attributes.action: Amend the Trade Union Act 2016 to remove trade union immunity from damages.
attributes.background: RMT & ASLEF have been striking for no discernible aim other than to cause harm to the commuters that use Southern Rail. They have wreaked untold costs upon individuals, families & businesses, yet they have legal immunity from the laws that govern every other person & organisation in the country.
attributes.additional_details:
This advantage that gives unions legal immunity from any claims for damages arising from their behaviour, however destructive, is wrong. Even the government has been taken to court by an individual before being allowed to invoke article 50, yet someone that loses their job because of persistent union action has no recourse to the courts, it is unjust and unfair. 

Unjustifiable strikes must stop, unfair advantages must stop.
 
Please help to get the Trade Union Act 2016 amended and remove the unfair trade union immunity from damages.

attributes.action: Give HMRC more funding to help stamp out tax evasion.
attributes.background: Tax fraud costs the government  Â£16bn every year. HMRC are making cuts to "save money" in reality these job losses are hurting the economy. Tax avoidance is hurting services like the NHS and is leading to low earning citizens having to pay higher taxes. Sign to make the government give more funding.

attributes.action: Limit the public use of drones
attributes.background: We believe that the public use of drones is a very real threat to the public and to the community around you. For example there is very easy access to drones and could be used in the wrong way. For example planes have had near misses which could have caused potential threats to the passengers.
attributes.additional_details: I would like greater expansion and enforcement of drone no-fly areas better as serious threats can be caused.There have been cases where drones have been flown into prisons and where drones have been flown over major cities without authorisation which could be potentially life threatening for the public in light of the recent terror attacks in France and Paris. Terrorists could use this equipment. Islamic state already uses drones for surveillance missions and propaganda purposes.

attributes.action: Create a report on cannabis legalisation worldwide
attributes.background:
Cannabis is being legalised and regulated worldwide, for recreational and medicinal use.

We need a full, detailed report which uses up to date science on any health benefits from cannabis and that also looks at the varying models of regulation of cannabis worldwide.

attributes.action: Make driving 25mph or more UNDER the speed limit a punishable offence.
attributes.background: When driving on dual carriage ways or 50mph A roads getting stuck behind drivers who are driving at a speed significantly slower than the speed limit set is a common occurence. It causes unnecessary over taking and can potentially be as dangerous as someone speeding. It needs to be addressed.

attributes.action: Stop Dover Harbour Board dredging the Goodwin Sands.
attributes.background: Dover Harbour Board want to extract marine aggregate from the Goodwins. Home to 350 grey seals and the some 2,000 shipwrecks. We are already susceptible to erosion. Beach recharging works are constant. Flooding along the East Kent coast is continual problem which would be exacerbated by dredging.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a current petition to raise awareness, as detailed below.
https://you.38degrees.org.uk/petitions/goodwin-sands-sos-stop-the-dredge
This has reached over 12,000 signatures.
Please help save the Goodwin Sands and their neighbouring environment from the destruction of dredging by signing this petition today and also by writing to the Marine Management Organisation with your concerns.
Letters can be emailed to marine.consents@marinemanagement.org.uk quoting the reference 
MLA/2016/00227.

attributes.action: Review funding into public services. Local authorities, NHS,police etc need help
attributes.background: Working in the public sector I have seen a decline in the last few years and knowing what future budgets hold I fear for communities. Had funding been correct over the years then there wouldn't be issues such as complaints on GP access or lack of bin collections etc
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence here is qualitative:
We all know someone who:

* Has struggled to see a doctor 
* Is homeless or can't get housing 
* Parents who scramble each year for a decent school place
* who is struggling to afford to eat
* works too many hours because they can't afford childcare 
* damaged a tyre due to pot holes in roads 
* Lack of landscaping 
* crime not responded too

attributes.action: Create an age and licence type restriction for drivers of more powerful cars
attributes.background: Young bikers are restricted as to how powerful a bike they can ride based on their age & licence type, yet car drivers can drive any car at any age once they've passed a manual test. This leaves fast cars in the hands of people who aren't competent to drive them, and is also unfair to bikers.
attributes.additional_details: Government statistics from 2011 show that 22% of road fatalities in that year involved drivers aged 17-24. A motorcycle-style age and licence grading system needs to be enforced to reduce these figures.

attributes.action: Update the infrastructure for Army families in Woolwich
attributes.background: The soldiers & their families in Woolwich living in Service Family Accommodation don't enjoy Fibre Broadband despite surrounding areas being connected. Internet is used to stay in touch with loved ones (deployed) and it's a disgrace that for economic reasons infrastructure is left outdated.
attributes.additional_details: All parties in relation to the issue have been contacted with no result so far in 2 years. BT and Virgin cannot make a business case and the MoD told us residents need to self-fund fibre. Self funding however is not an option for a large portion of soldier families being attached to The Vikings, who re-locate every 5 years! The council has no jurisdiction. We've been left to struggle with inconceivably slow broadband surrounded by private housing with fibre access, in a London suburb in zone 4.

attributes.action: Drivers causing death by dangerous driving should be banned for life,
attributes.background: Due to the amount of fatalities caused by drivers who have no respect for other road users ; mobile phones being a prime example, a car should be classed as a weapon in the wrong hands.

attributes.action: Condemn the use of non-nuclear and chemical weapons on Afghanistan
attributes.background: The USA dropped the MOAB on Afghanistan today. Of course this was done to destroy 'ISIS' tunnels, but a bomb of this scale is clearly unproportionate to the threat. This act almost made Afghanistan seem like a testing ground to the US. I urge the UK government to condemn such action and not follow.
attributes.additional_details:
Information on the size and power of the bomb, as well as the reason of the bombing: 
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.cnn.com/cnn/2017/04/13/politics/afghanistan-isis-moab-bomb/index.html

Within this article the destructive power of the bomb is highlighted, and is clarified. The reason as to why the U.K shouldn't follow in the steps of the US is also made apparent.

attributes.action: Ban the use of single use carrier bags for groceries delivered to home.
attributes.background: Masses of plastic carrier bags are wasted every day by people who order groceries online, have it delivered in plastic totes and then have everything in carrier bags to take their shopping out of the totes and into their homes which is about 30 seconds of use.
attributes.additional_details: Every day in the UK thousands of single use carrier bags are used by supermarkets and their customers for their home delivered goods despite the goods already being packed into delivery totes, this is a massive waste of plastic and also causes environmental harm.

attributes.action: Lower voting age in the North of Ireland from 18 to 16.
attributes.background: We, as young people, demand that the British Government allow people over the age of 16 in the North of Ireland to exercise their right to vote in elections.
attributes.additional_details:
MLAs in the Assembly endorsed a joint Sinn FÃ©in and Green Party motion in 2012 backing the lowering of the voting age from 18 to 16. 

This process will allow young people to fully engage with local politics and also their local communities. It's vital that young people have a voice in deciding the course of their future.

attributes.action: Place health warnings on fast food and meat packaging the same as cigarettes.
attributes.background: strain on the nhs is apparent based on government guidelines. changes to improve health with measures such as cigarette packaging showing health issues needs to be extended further. Placing pics of animal processing in factory farms and heart ops on meat & fast food packaging to raise awareness.

attributes.action: Change the rules of voting so that you have to vote in permanent ink.
attributes.background: There has been complaints in the past that voting in pencil can leave our votes open to being changed, as pencil marks can get erased, but if we vote in permanent ink, people will be more confident that their vote will count, so more people will be encouraged to vote.

attributes.action: Abolish British Summer Time (BST)
attributes.background: Areas affected by the change should adjust their operating hours accordingly.

attributes.action: Introduce free higher education for those who volunteer 1 year of public service
attributes.background: Very high education costs mean that volunteers struggle to further their education. This means there is a deficit of people supporting our public services (e.g. charities, health services, army).

attributes.action: Make online providers legally responsible for the content they publish.
attributes.background: Online content providers such as Youtube and Facebook provide a channel to publish content in the UK. However, unlike more traditional media outlets, including television and radio stations and the traditional printed press, there is an almost total lack of editorial oversight.
attributes.additional_details: There are increasing incidents of content needing to be removed post broadcast, often well after any damage has been caused. In addition, increasing examples of "fake news/facts" are now also being seen, some with significant implications. Online media owners created the tools being used to disseminate this content and benefit from the revenues such broadcast generates. As such, they must become legally responsible for whatever they publish.

attributes.action: Make lie detector tests mandatory when questioning suspects in a serious crime
attributes.background: When questioning suspects involved in sex offences, manslaughter, murders, and missing persons, polygraph tests should be a mandatory part of the police interviewing process, even if the crime was overseas. The test should be taken more than once to minimise the chance of false readings.

attributes.action: Government build more new affordable council housing to stop ever higher rents.
attributes.background: More & more people are having to rent privately & rents are far to high for most people & taxpayers money is going to private landlords who keep their housing benefit tenants in slum-like conditions. This must stop. If there was more council housing rents would come down.
attributes.additional_details:
One million homes in the private rented sector fail to meet basic standards of safety, warmth and repair, a report reveals.

Billions of pounds of taxpayers' money is being spent on housing benefit for rent given to private landlords who fail to keep the properties in good condition. The money would be better spent on build new council housing.

attributes.action: Send Help For African Droughts
attributes.background: Today, as you are reading this, droughts in Africa are happening, I want your to sign this petition so we can send help to these dying people, everyday children and adults die in Somalia, and there are many more in other countries, no food or not a lot of water, they will not survive!

attributes.action: Stop the capture and collection of live, wild caught wrasse.
attributes.background: The taking of wild ballan wrasse to use within the cage culture of salmonid species is detrimental to the UK coastal environment. It takes on average 6 years for a ballan to reach sexual maturity and collecting and taking them from the wild can have long term negative impacts.

attributes.action: Update the border with Scotland based on the popular vote at constituency level.
attributes.background: The border with Scotland has moved north and south over the centuries, but since the Act of Union of 1707 in it has been largely arbitrary. Indeed Berwick on Tweed has passed over the border on a number of occasions.
attributes.additional_details: It seems over recent months and years there has been a surge in Scottish pride and the true border between England and Scotland (where the majority of the residence identify as Scottish) may have shifted to the south. There should be a referendum in each constituency of England (and Wales) to ascertain whether the majority of the residents identify as Scottish.

attributes.action: Publish tax/NI rate req to fully fund Schools, NHS/Soc Care Policing & Prisons
attributes.background: We want our public services to be effective and available, constant  tinkering by  political parties and "spin" when answering questions have not helped. If we all knew the real size of the problem and the actions required to correct it then it would be easier to have the necessary public debate.
attributes.additional_details:
It would appear to be impossible to continue to expect our public services to continually increase the level of service required in Education, Health and Social Care and changing the aim and culture of Police and the Prison service whilst continuing to expect to pay less tax to fund them .

Perhaps it is time to understand what services are required and the true cost of supplying them

attributes.action: REMOVE  all restrictions from the Â£100,000 Transferable Main Residence Tax(RNRB)
attributes.background:
The RNRB, an addition to the IHT allowance, states this property allowance is only exempt from IHT if the property is bequeathed to a direct descendant of the deceased, or their spouse/civil partner.
For RNRB purposes common law partners or relatives such as nephews,nieces,siblings are exempt.
attributes.additional_details:
INSTEAD give the allowance restriction free, to all property owners,  enabling them to bequeath as much of their main residence free from IHT as possible.
This would increase the  current Â£325,000 IHT threshold by Â£100,000. Increasing to Â£500,000 by 2020.This then can be bequeathed to anybody you choose
See https://www.gov.uk/wills-probate-inheritance/overview. Select IHT go to item 2,

attributes.action: To be able to claim carers allowance per person that you care for
attributes.background: Iam a mother of two children who both receive middle rate DLA for there disability Primary Ciliary Dyskinesia. Currently as the system works you can only claim carers allowance for 1 child / adult , even through when caring for two is double the work load and time spent.

attributes.action: Cap graduation fees for university students.
attributes.background:
University graduation costs have become too expensive. Many universities charge  between Â£20 to Â£40 a ticket for each family member. This is not accessible to those who are on lower incomes in any way.

Cap what they can charge, and make this more accessible to all students and their families.

attributes.action: Abolish the Cancer Act of 1939, numerous scientifically proven cures exist(MHRA)
attributes.background: Although it has been known for decades in certain academic circles, there is now an already huge and growing library of information on the Internet that proves cancer can be cured through using numerous different agents. Examples include THC found in the cannabis plant, mistloe, & the protein GcMAf.
attributes.additional_details:
Food & Drug Administration admits cannabis can kill cancer http://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/treatment/cam/patient/cannabis-pdq#link/_13

MHRA admits CBD is MEDICINE http://www.gov.uk/government/news/mhra-statement-on-products-containing-cannabidiol-cbd

Cannabinoids as therapeutic agents in cancer http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4171598/#__abstractid916790title 

DEATHS fall MJ legal states http://europe.newsweek.com/states-medical-marijuana-painkiller-deaths-drop-25-266577?rm=eu

attributes.action: GCSE students receive a letter grade instead of a number grade for all subjects
attributes.background: For many years, GCSE students have received a letter grade instead of a number grade, so hanging it is inconvenient and confusing. It would be hard to tell what grade is good and Universities will find this a challenge.
attributes.additional_details: This change would be made for all subjects, including the core subjects, to simplify the grading system and stop and confusion.

attributes.action: Urge the government to extend Help to Buy to include old properties.
attributes.background: The Government has dragged it's heels dealing with the housing crisis in London so as a result we need to urge them to do more regarding affordable housing. One of the things the government can and should do is extend the Help to Buy scheme to include older properties.
attributes.additional_details: The help to buy scheme could be really useful if it were extended to include older properties. The government should also charge a percentage identical to the bank of England base rate after the 5yr free period. If the UK government is serious about helping Londoners get on the ladder they should revise the Help to Buy scheme immediately to include older properties as house builders have pushed up the cost of new builds at an alarming rate. Not everyone wants a new build.

attributes.action: Change the British legal system
attributes.background: Bring back the death penalty for murderers, rapists, kidnappers and pedophiles. In addition to corporal punishment for vandals and petty criminals.

attributes.action: Condemn the murderous attacks on the elected Leader of the Bakongo people.
attributes.background: The mandate of the current government expired on 19 December 2016. After 16 years Hyppolite Kanambe alias Joseph Kabila refuses to relinquish power and must be held accountable for the murder of un-armed civilians by Police and soldiers ultimately under his control.
attributes.additional_details: There is photographic evidence of the slaughter of un-armed civilians at the residence of The Honourable Muanda Nsemi  an elected government deputy. Currently his home is under siege with all amenities cut. At his residence there are the elderly, women and children who went there to pray. I have information that the situation is deteriorating and risks to human life is high. We want the International community to intervene to save the lives of the People of Congo. It is Imperative to act now.

attributes.action: Save Southport A&E hospital
attributes.background:
Southport A&E hospital is on a list for closing. Think about it..... if you or your family needed emergency care where and how long would it take to get there never mind about being in the nhs queue to receive treatment. 
Please help everyone you know. Let's save southport A&E!!!!!!!

attributes.action: Government to introduce clause to declassify first class on trains at peak times
attributes.background: During peak / commuter hours, many trains are running at capacity except for the first class areas, which are often empty. This is forcing people to stand when they could be sitting in comfort and therefore having a more enjoyable commute to work.
attributes.additional_details: As the government is responsible for issuing the franchises to companies to run trains on the railways, I am calling for a clause to be added at the time of renewals for first class to be de classified during peak hours or on commuter trains. Unlike the intercity trains, there are no real benefits from having first class (i.e no refreshment service) and the seats are often no different. These seats could be used by more people and offer value for money when prices are  increasing annually.

attributes.action: Allow Motorcross bikes to ride in public parks or fields
attributes.background: Allow Motorcross bikes to be ridden in fields or parks instead of being chased by police

attributes.action: Delay Article 50 until the policy of the US towards Russia and NATO is clearer
attributes.background: A strong European Union is essential if stronger ties between the US and Russia are formed and US support for NATO is reduced. Triggering Article 50 before US policy becomes clear could be highly detrimental to the stability of all European countries including the UK.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2017/feb/09/brexit-trump-britain-national-security-article-50

attributes.action: Reduce the UK's foreign aid budget from 0.7% GDP to 0.1% GDP.
attributes.background: Increase Social Care Funding by reducing the UK's foreign aid budget from 0.7% GDP Â£12 Billion Pounds to 0.1% GDP Â£1.714  Billion Pounds. The remaining 0.6% of GDP Â£10.285 Billion Pounds could then be used to increase funding for Social Care and improve the quality of life of British Citizens.

attributes.action: Tattoos legal for 16 years olds with parental consent
attributes.background: I believe that as long as there is a parent present or on the phone when the child wants the tattoo then that is acceptable because I'm sure a parent wouldn't let their 16 year old get something tattooed that they will obviously regret in the future and the parent will want to know what it is before
attributes.additional_details: I'm 16 years old and personally I want a tattoo my mum found no reason as to why I shouldn't have one as it's not something inappropriate that I will want to have removed or covered up and i believe that a parents opinion matters as if I was to get a tattoo without my parents consent I'm more likely to get an unsuitable, unacceptable or regrettable tattoo I understand some parents don't want their child being tattooed thats why I think it is fair to have parental consent beforehand

attributes.action: Parliament to debate scrapping Trident in order to fund care for the elderly.
attributes.background: Instead of paying Â£40bn for a white elephant that serves no purpose other than for illusory political prestige, we can fuund care of the elderly as it becomes an increasing burden on the NHS and Local Authorities, saving the need to increase taxation
attributes.additional_details: None needed - public domain

attributes.action: Allow a recall of mps petition without suspension or criminal charge
attributes.background: Currently the recall of mps bill only allows for a recall petition to be triggered if there is a criminal charge against your MP or if they have been suspended from the House. I believe that it should be possible to start a petition to recall your MP if you believe they aren't representing you.

attributes.action: Charge for GP apptments. Allow GP's to dispense low cost drugs such as aspirin.
attributes.background:
A small charge for visit to GP would deter time wasters & release funds for deserving needs. 
GP's prescribe aspirin and similar drugs costing a few pence which incur standard Â£10-Â£12 "Pharmacy handling" charge to the Dept of Health. Curb this waste too and spend on more deserving needs
attributes.additional_details:
From data in the public domain it is evident that many patients fail to attend appointments with virtually no financial penalty. A Â£5-Â£10 per person per appointment (with some exceptions) is affordable by the majority of inhabitants.
Prescriptions for low cost (normally over the counter) drugs incur significant "handling" charge. By permitting/instructing GP's to dispense such items the savings can be diverted/used to benefit more urgent demands on the Health Service.

attributes.action: Right tostrike in essential services replaced by referralto adjudication service
attributes.background: For too long commuters/patients/the public have been the victims of protracted disputes between the unions of essential service providers and local/central government employers. Strikes are a primitive/inefficient way of resolving disputes and should be replaced by a binding adjudication service

attributes.action: Petition to increase the lowest acceptable broadband speed from 2Mbps to 10Mbps
attributes.background: The Government definition of 'basic broadband' is 2Mbps. At 2Mbps many internet services do not work. Internet usage must be limited to 1 person per household and it is difficult to load the government's own HMRC site - making life difficult for SMEs and the self employed.
attributes.additional_details: From experience, I know it is easy for Openreach to achieve speeds of 2Mbps through the UK's existing infrastructure (predominantly still copper wiring from the 1950s/60s). If the lowest acceptable broadband speed is not increased to 10Mbps, Openreach will focus on improving broadband in built up, high profit areas - areas that largely already have good internet access. The 5G roll out plan typifies this. If the focus is not shifted, many areas will never receive a decent internet connection.

attributes.action: Prevent Xi Jinping from making any State Visits to the United Kingdom
attributes.background: Xi Jinping should not be allowed to enter the UK in his capacity as head of the Chinese government due to the Chinese communist parties prolific violation of human rights.
attributes.additional_details: Since Xi Jinping became President of the People's Republic of China (PRC) in March 2013, the human rights group CHRD has documented more than 1,800 cases of arbitrary detention and torture of human rights activists and lawyers.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for schools to discriminate uniform between boys and girls
attributes.background: Schools all around the UK make children wear separate uniforms, this causes problems to arise through clashes of opinion in terms of what parents thinks children should wear and what the school demands that they wear. In this world of 'equality' surely we should start at the route of inequality.

attributes.action: PSHE in all schools includes topics about domestic violence, LGBTQ+ and consent.
attributes.background: As pupils, we feel it necessary to have issues on domestic violence, LGBTQ+ rights and consent included in the curriculum of all senior PSHE lessons. We believe that this is crucial as all young adults should be well educated about these topics and should be able to access support and true facts.
attributes.additional_details: The Government has already talked about this issue, yet they briefly touched on it and didn't look leave enough time to fully discuss and vote on this important issue.

attributes.action: Publish a White Paper on the Brexit plan before Parliament's vote on Article 50
attributes.background: The Government should be transparent and accountable to Parliament with regards to its plans for negotiations to exit the EU. A White Paper setting out its plans should be published to enable proper debate in Parliament before the vote on triggering Article 50.

attributes.action: Reduce school summer holidays from 6 weeks to 2.
attributes.background: As a working parent I find it almost impossible to find affordable childcare for my children during the 6 weeks holidays. Most people only receive 21 days annual leave from work.
attributes.additional_details: With lack of affordable childcare for primary and high school aged children, it makes it almost impossible for most parents to find or afford childcare for the six week summer holiday. We need to move with the times and support people who want to work. Children are no longer required to help with summer harvest. 6 weeks is too long!

attributes.action: Increase government funding for child abuse organisations and therapy services.
attributes.background:
Thousands of children everyday are being abused, in the UK.  
How can we as citizens do nothing to help the vulnerable children being tormented?  How can we let the dreams of the youth be destroyed?
 They will be OUR FUTURE! YOU can make a difference by signing this petition.
attributes.additional_details:
-There are currently over 57,000 children identified as needing protection from abuse in the UK
-For every child identified as needing protection from abuse, another 8 are suffering abuse. 
https://www.nspcc.org.uk/services-and-resources/research-and-resources/statistics/

Remember YOU can help change their lives. So, support this cause.

attributes.action: All car drivers should be made to do a CPC course like professional drivers.
attributes.background: Driving on today's roads are very challenging and dangerous, when I was recently in a speeding awareness course, 19 out of 20 people where totally clueless about lots of rules and regulations from the highway code, everybody must be retrained for everybody's safety
